title: Narendra Modi’s Party Faces Test in Uttar Pradesh, India’s ‘California and Texas Rolled Into One’
sub_head: Prime minister’s Bharatiya Janata Party vies for support in country’s most populous state amid discontent over inflation, failed farming overhaul
body:
LUCKNOW, India—When it comes to Indian politics, there is no greater prize than Uttar Pradesh. With more than 200 million people, it is the most populous state and it has been a linchpin of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s success.
“It’s like California and Texas rolled into one,” said Irfan Nooruddin, director of the South Asia Center at the Atlantic Council, a think tank based in Washington. “It’s very hard to form a national government if you can’t win UP.”
